arm_group.description: Watching the soccer match at the time that the favorite team is playing
Watching a movie at the time that the favorite team is playing

brief_summary.textblock:
Watching football matches could cause increased blood pressure and heart rate induced by
      catecholamines and thus increase the incidence of cardiovascular events. However, no studies
      have evaluated the responses of blood pressure and heart rate in soccer spectators.

      This study evaluates the hemodynamic response in Brazilian soccer fans suffering from
      coronary artery disease during a dispute over a game of your favorite team.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiovascular Effects of a Soccer Match in Viewers With With Coronary Artery Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Coronary artery disease;

          -  Avai or Figueirense (brazilian soccer teams) fans

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute coronary syndrome in less than 7 days

intervention.description: Watching the soccer match at the time that the favorite team is playing
Watching a movie at the time that the favorite team is playing

facility.name: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

clinical_study.official_title: Cardiovascular Effects of a Soccer Match in Viewers With With Coronary Artery Disease

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the difference between the average mean arterial pressure in patients with coronary artery disease, or not watching a game of soccer your favorite team;

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the difference between the mean heart rate;
To evaluate the difference between the systolic blood pressure;
To evaluate the difference between the diastolic blood pressure;
To evaluate the difference between the double product (the product of heart rate and systolic blood pressure);
To evaluate the difference between the presence of angina;

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
